getAscent

public int getAscent()
Enabled: Returns the ascent of the font described by the receiver. A font's ascent is the distance from the baseline to the top of actual characters, not including any of the leading area, measured in pixels.

Returns:
the ascent of the font

getAverageCharWidth

public int getAverageCharWidth()
Enabled: Returns the average character width, measured in pixels, of the font described by the receiver.

Returns:
the average character width of the font

getDescent

public int getDescent()
Enabled: Returns the descent of the font described by the receiver. A font's descent is the distance from the baseline to the bottom of actual characters, not including any of the leading area, measured in pixels.

Returns:
the descent of the font

getHeight

public int getHeight()
Enabled: Returns the height of the font described by the receiver, measured in pixels. A font's height is the sum of its ascent, descent and leading area.

Returns:
the height of the font
See Also:
getAscent(), getDescent(), getLeading()

getLeading

public int getLeading()
Enabled: Returns the leading area of the font described by the receiver. A font's leading area is the space above its ascent which may include accents or other marks.

Returns:
the leading space of the font

Overrides:

Returns:
the receiver's hash
See Also:

win32_new

public static FontMetrics win32_new(org.eclipse.swt.internal.win32.TEXTMETRIC handle)
Suppressed: Invokes platform specific functionality to allocate a new font metrics.

IMPORTANT: This method is not part of the public API for FontMetrics. It is marked public only so that it can be shared within the packages provided by SWT. It is not available on all platforms, and should never be called from application code.
